page.title: 16Wildlife - Reptiles
page.content: The {slow-worm}has eyelids, a fixed jaw and a notched not a forked tongue. Its average length is about 30cm, and brown or grey is the usual colour. It feeds on moving prey only, including worms and insects. {Common lizards}are about 15cm long. The prey mainly on spiders and insects. The {grass snake}is the largest British snake and is not poisonous. It grows up to 1.20m in length. Its main diet is frogs supplemented by newts and toads. The{viper}or{adder}is the commonest British snake and is the only poisonous one. It averages 60cm in length. It is easily recognized by the distinctive zig-zag pattern along the back. It feeds on rodents and young birds.
